result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin J Berg

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 8:31am 
Defendant Austin J Berg in court with Attorney Kirk Emick. DA Monica Hall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Emick requests the scheduling of a plea and sentencing hearing in January. 
The Court directs Attorney Emick to advise the Defendant regarding the intended judicial rotation; a different court will be assigned this case in January. 
recess 8:33am.

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on January 12th at 8:30am

Pre-trial conference on September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 9:02AM
Defendant Austin J Berg in court with Attorney Kirk R. Emick. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This file is scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing, however the Court notes that it has a waiver on file.

The Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered as to all four Counts
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

recess 9:06AM

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 09/14 at 8:30AM with counsel appearances only  (2) Status Conference on 10/31 at 8:30AM with in person appearances
Preliminary hearing on August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

[ae] case called 8:28 AM Defendant Austin J Berg in court. Attorney Kirk R. Emick in court.  ADA Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct and updates address
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited

Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $5,000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 8:33 am
NEXT Preliminary Hearing on 8/26/22 at 8:30 am
